issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

This message was automatically generated.

Could you elaborate on what the problem is, and how the patch proposes to fix it?  This is a test that's been around a while, so I'm curious what changed recently to break it.

The patch changes path concatenation from a cross-platform manner using File to a harcoded form -- why was this done?

[~jlowe], thanks for review and comment concerns! Right, this broken test used to work, its current error seem to be caused by jdk change. In the test, the {{TEST_ROOT_DIR}} is {code}file:/Users/changli/hadoop/hadoop/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/target/test-dir/ {code} when I run the test on my machine. But {{TEST_VISIBILITY_DIR}} is {code} file:/Users/changli/hadoop/hadoop/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/file:/Users/changli/hadoop/hadoop/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/target/test-dir/TestCacheVisibility/{code} which used to be {code}file:/Users/changli/hadoop/hadoop/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/target/test-dir/TestCacheVisibility{code}. When a file created by {{File(String parent, String child)}}, its absolute pathname and pathname differed as above. The {{testDetermineCacheVisibilities}} intended to test under {{file:/Users/changli/hadoop/hadoop/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/target/test-dir/TestCacheVisibility}} which is TestCacheVisibility dir under {{TEST_ROOT_DIR}}, so I reconstruct the TEST_VISIBILITY_DIR string by this simple way rather than the unnecessarily complicate means from File to URI then to String.

The problem is not the File constructor but rather the result when it gets turned into a URI.  The File constructor call is building the path {{file:/Users/changli/hadoop/hadoop/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/target/test-dir/TestCacheVisibility}} correctly.

Since TEST_ROOT_DIR and TEST_VISIBILITY_DIR always want to be treated as {{Path}} objects then a better fix would be to simply create them as such.  I don't see a need for the extraneous string replacement and URI conversions.  Then it's not hardcoded on a certain path separator and the code is cleaner.
Thanks [~jlowe] for review! have updated .2 patch according to your suggestion to create them as Path object

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks for updating the patch!  Looks good except for something I just noticed -- the test is trying to change the permissions of the root directory, and that could fall back to a very public place like /tmp.  The test build directory should not be manipulated directly.  Looks like there needs to be another directory level added if the permissions really need to be modified on the visibility directory's parent.
Thanks [~jlowe] for further review! update .4 patch to address your concern

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |
